title: Type in Nike posters
content:
Hello. Trying to find out the font used in these posters.

Thanks everyone.

Ross

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [typeposters.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20120124015908/http:/typophile.com/files/typeposters.jpg) | 121.6 KB |
| [typeposters6.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20120124015908/http:/typophile.com/files/typeposters6.jpg) | 390.1 KB |
| [typeposters7.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20120124015908/http:/typophile.com/files/typeposters7.jpg) | 331.44 KB |
author: rossrote

comments.content: I'd love to know this as well. It seems a bit tactile, but its a digital font, seeing there are the same letters used all over.

I looked at the first poster, and that looks like [H&FJ Knockout](http://web.archive.org/web/20120124015908/http:/www.typography.com/fonts/font_styles.php?productLineID=100013) (No. 70 , I think). There are 32 weights/widths, so picking the right one may involve using their test drive, but I think No. 70 looks pretty close to my eye.

- Mike Yanega

I tried the Test Drive thing myself, and I can see that Knockout is only similar. The K, W and R are not right (among others), although they may be close enough, depending on your purposes. I am still trying to see if I can find a better match.

- Mike Yanega

So far I have not found anything closer than Knockout. Another similar font is [Rhode Medium Condensed](http://web.archive.org/web/20120124015908/http:/www.fontshop.com/search/?q=Rhode&x=22&y=9&sample_text=WALKING%20FOSTER), and it does have the right K, but the uneven arms of the E & F are more like Knockout.

It may be a customized mix of the two fonts, but more likely it is a customized version of Knockout, if I had to guess.

- Mike Yanega
